intro: Rudgea graciliflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered rudgea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
